statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Richmond's balanced scoring pushes past St. Bonaventure
article.headline: Richmond's balanced scoring pushes past St. Bonaventure
article.linkText: Richmond's balanced scoring pushes past St. Bonaventure
article.story: SAINT BONAVENTURE, N.Y. -- ShawnDre' Jones scored 17 points to lead five Richmond players in double figures as the Spiders beat St. Bonaventure 71-56 on Wednesday night. Junior Terry Allen had 15 points, 13 in the second half, with 11 rebounds to record his third-career double-double for Richmond (14-12, 7-6 Atlantic 10). T.J. Cline added 14 points, Deion Taylor had 11 and Kendall Anthony 10 as the Spiders made 26 of 52 shots (50 percent), including eight 3-pointers. Youssou Ndoye scored 12 points for St. Bonaventure (13-11, 6-7), and Dion Wright and Andell Cumberbatch added 10 apiece. The Bonnies turned it over 19 times. St. Bonaventure led 42-38 midway through the second half, before Richmond went on a 14-0 run to take a 52-42 lead with 7:22 left. Cline and Jones hit 3-pointers during the spurt and the duo combined for six overall.
